page.title: 02THE WARMINSTER BY-PASS
page.content: For over 30 years there have been plans to by-pass Warminster. The town is an important road transport route centre.The result is heavy traffic all day long. Much of the traffic consists of heavy lorries - especially those carrying Mendip limestone to the South East. Other heavy traffic consists of container lorries travelling between the ports of Bristol and Southampton. The noise,fumes and vibrations caused by this heavy through traffic led to a lengthy campaign by local people until the Government announced a new road to open in 1987, by-passing the town and rejoining the A36 at Heytesbury. Public opinion is divided.Some prefer a quiet town with a traffic free main street.Others are concerned that businesses will lose a vital part of their trade.
